snippet: The professional social network’s Chinese-language version, which lacks certain features of Western versions, seems to have the tacit approval of China’s government.
abstract: LinkedIn has found success in China where other American technology companies have largely failed, earning what seems to be tacit approval of government; social network has made several concessions to Chinese authorities, compromising on free expression and relinquishing 7 percent of its local operation to two well-connected Chinese venture capital firms; moves are being closely watched by Silicon Valley as it tries to crack vast Chinese market.

byline.original: By PAUL MOZUR and VINDU GOEL
byline.contributor: Paul Mozur reported from Hong Kong and Vindu Goel from San Francisco.

lead_paragraph: The professional social network’s Chinese-language version, which lacks certain features of Western versions, seems to have the tacit approval of China’s government.

headline.main: To Reach China, LinkedIn Plays by Local Rules
headline.print_headline: To Reach China, LinkedIn Plays by Local Rules
